title: Body Count - MP3 [320kbps] (1992)
description:
Body Count is a band of Hardcore / Rap American metal formed in Los Angeles, California in 1990. It was founded by Ice-T, best known for his contributions in hip hop. Ice-T founded the group because of his interest in heavy metal, and assumed the role of lead singer, writing the lyrics of most songs, while music was written by guitarist Ernie C. Her debut album Body Count it was released by Sire Records in 1992.

The song 'Cop Killer' was the subject of much controversy; The Argentina Hardcore / Metal A. N. I. M. A. L. translated this song into Spanish. Although the parent company of Sire Records, Warner Bros. Records, defended the simple, Ice-T decided to remove the track from the album because he felt the controversy had overshadowed the music itself. The group withdrew from Sire the following year. Since then he has released three more albums on different labels, none of which has been received, neither commercial nor critical, as their debut album.

Three of the original members have died: bassist Mooseman (2001) by a shot from a car, guitarist D-Roc (2004) lymphoma, and drummer Beatmaster V (1996) of leukemia
